natural solution: label("2", (4,5), E); label("4", (2,6), N); draw((1,4)--(3,4), linetype("8 8")); [/asy] The perimeter is $4 + 2 + 1 + 4 + 2 + 4 + 1 + 2 = \boxed{20}\text{ inches}$. \[ OR \]Each rectangle has perimeter $= 2l + 2w = 2(4) + 2(2) = 8 + 4 = 12$ inches.

When the two rectangles are positioned to form the T, a two-inch segment of each rectangle is inside the T and is not on the perimeter of the T. So the perimeter of the T is $2(12) - 2(2) = 24 - 4 = \boxed{20}$ inches.
